timeline.bodyText: maybe we don't need this extension as here we don't use parallel builds at all
timeline.author: mareknovotny
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,45 @@
+name: Build Chain Full Downstream
+
+on: [pull_request]
+
+jobs:
+  build-chain:
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]
+        java-version: [11]
+      fail-fast: false
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    name: Maven Build
+    steps:
+      - name: Set up JDK
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: ${{ matrix.java-version }}
+      - name: Install takari (non-windows)
+        if: ${{ matrix.os != 'windows-latest' }}
+        run: |
+          wget -P $M2_HOME/lib/ext https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/aether/takari-local-repository/0.11.3/takari-local-repository-0.11.3.jar
+          wget -P $M2_HOME/lib/ext https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/takari-filemanager/0.8.3/takari-filemanager-0.8.3.jar
+          wget -P $M2_HOME/lib/ext https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/maven/takari-smart-builder/0.6.1/takari-smart-builder-0.6.1.jar
+      - name: Install takari (windows)
+        if: ${{ matrix.os == 'windows-latest' }}
+        run: |
+          (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile("https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/aether/takari-local-repository/0.11.3/takari-local-repository-0.11.3.jar", "$Env:M2_HOME\lib\ext\takari-local-repository-0.11.3.jar")
+          (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile("https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/takari-filemanager/0.8.3/takari-filemanager-0.8.3.jar", "$Env:M2_HOME\lib\ext\takari-filemanager-0.8.3.jar")
+          (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile("https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/maven/takari-smart-builder/0.6.1/takari-smart-builder-0.6.1.jar", "$Env:M2_HOME\lib\ext\takari-smart-builder-0.6.1.jar")

replies.bodyText: I was not sure about it... removing it
replies.author: Ginxo

replies.bodyText: removed
replies.author: Ginxo

timeline.bodyText: Tooling, images and operator has a different CI configuration and the build is probably neither maven based so please remove them from here and close corresponding PRs ( kiegroup/kogito-images#281 kiegroup/kogito-operator#653 )
timeline.author: danielezonca
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+version: "2.0"
+dependencies:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-apps
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+    mapping:
+      dependencies:
+        default:
+          source: stable
+          target: master
+      source: master
+      target: stable
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-tooling
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-images
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-apps
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-cloud-operator
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-images
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples

replies.bodyText: I would add that project dependencies should be defined in each project, not all in one place for readability of the CI in a project ...
replies.author: radtriste

replies.bodyText: fyi the centralized config can be overriden or customized in the individual repositories.
replies.author: mareknovotny

replies.bodyText: done, thanks @danielezonca
replies.author: Ginxo

timeline.bodyText: Can't those command be defined in each project ?
timeline.author: radtriste
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+version: "2.0"
+
+dependencies: ./project-dependencies.yaml
+
+build:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+    build-command:
+      upstream: |
+        mvn clean install -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+      current: |
+        mvn clean install -Prun-code-coverage -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn validate -Psonarcloud-analysis -e -nsu -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn clean install -Pintegration-tests -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-apps

replies.bodyText: it could be, but sometimes centralized config is better, like we changed this for v7 repos. As any cross repo change involved all repository PRs to change it.
replies.author: mareknovotny

replies.bodyText: I have no problem to have central shared config (in kogito-pipelines ?) but dependencies and build commands should be defined in each repo
replies.author: radtriste

replies.bodyText: @radtriste we can obviously do it for each project. Whatever you want, but I would prefer  to centralize it in one single place since we are defining how the projects are related between each other, wdyt guys? @danielezonca @mareknovotny
replies.author: Ginxo

replies.bodyText:
My main problem is that if I work on kogito-images I would need to know where to look to understand what is happening on the PR check ... Each repo defines its commands and its dependencies is simpler to understand what is happening.
We have enforced this since the beginning in Kogito with Jenkinsfiles to be as explicit as possible and defined in the repo  itself.
btw, I think @evacchi would be interested as well.
replies.author: radtriste

replies.bodyText: I think it is reasonable for kogito repos to have individual configurations there are only 5/6 repositories. So no big deal
replies.author: mareknovotny

replies.bodyText: No strong opinion, in general I would prefer to be sure the build of a repo is independent from where the build started from (so centralised configuration) but I agree with @mareknovotny , we have few repos so not a big deal
replies.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: build configuration isolated on each repo kogito-examples, apps and runtimes
replies.author: Ginxo

timeline.bodyText: In general I would say that kogito-examples also depends on kogito-apps. I don't know if this is very true now but I would not prevent the creation of examples with components from -apps
timeline.author: danielezonca
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@

+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes

replies.author: Ginxo

timeline.bodyText:
In existing Jenkinsfile we use different folders to execute the different commands. Is this equivalent?
@radtriste to be honest I don't remember why we use different folders. Do you?
timeline.author: danielezonca
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@

+
+dependencies: ./project-dependencies.yaml
+
+build:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+    build-command:
+      upstream: |
+        mvn clean install -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+      current: |
+        mvn clean install -Prun-code-coverage -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn validate -Psonarcloud-analysis -e -nsu -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn clean install -Pintegration-tests -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3

replies.bodyText: @danielezonca it's not, so we should be sure the different folders are required, in this case I will have to somehow add this functionality to build-chain tool. @radtriste can you please confirm it?
replies.author: Ginxo

replies.bodyText: mainly to not override the junit results I would say
replies.author: radtriste

replies.bodyText: blocked by kiegroup/github-action-build-chain#108
replies.author: Ginxo

replies.bodyText: kiegroup/github-action-build-chain#108 resolved and configuration adapted
replies.author: Ginxo

timeline.bodyText: In kogito we usually always build and test all three repos. Can you please remove this workflow and change all pull-request files as full-downstream flow-type?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: pull request and full downstream at the same time is something good to have @radtriste @mareknovotny wdyt?
replies.author: Ginxo

timeline.bodyText: What about make it possible to run it with a "Jenkins retest this" comment cause most people are already used to that?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: I think github actions has some different possibility to re-run the build. I asked similar question in past, but there were some limitation. @Ginxo will know that what I forgot.
replies.author: mareknovotny

replies.bodyText: I tried something in the past but the PR details where not updated. This is something not handled by the build-chain tool itself but by another plugin. Since the jobs are triggered every time a change is pushed and you have the chance to go to the actions section (or to job details) and relaunch it we didn't invest too much time on it. I would treat this as a different change, do you agree?
replies.author: Ginxo

replies.bodyText:
Ok I think we can re-enable a similar behavior if needed via bot like the one we have on kogito-cloud-operator ( link ).
@ricardozanini wdyt?
replies.author: danielezonca

timeline.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: Tristan Radisson <tristan.radisson@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Disabling those could be a problem or ?
timeline.author: radtriste

replies.bodyText:
I tried to disable to see if the rest of the pipeline is green. To be honest I don't understand why they fail, my assumption is that io.fabric8.kubernetes.client.server.mock.KubernetesServer is trying to open a ports (or another networking related action) that is not allow inside a github pipeline so it fails (locally it works well).
If this is the only problem my plan is to merge the pipeline and rewrite those tests with another PR to replace this mocked kubernetes server with something different (probably a local mock or wiremock)
replies.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: oki
replies.author: radtriste

replies.bodyText: Ticket created https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-5093
replies.author: danielezonca
